# Preflight Checklist and Troubleshooting
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check if the APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check the APC unit's current Load* (W).
For additional information consult [textlink="Powerstorage" link="PowerStorage"/].
## 1.2. Generator
- Check if the generator is anchored to the floor. - Check if the generator has fuel. For extended flights make sure that you have enough fuel stockpiled to sustain prolonged power generation during flight. - Check if the generator is set to HV output. - Start the generator unit. - Set Target Power for the through power amount indicated by your substation. - Power draw may seem excessively high while power storage systems recharge.
## 1.3. Solar panels
- Inspect solar control computer. - Adjust panel angular velocity. - Adjust panel angle. - There may be a slight lag period before power generation is reported.
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Check that the oxygen and nitrogen canisters are anchored to the connector port. - Check that the distribution mixer is set to 101kPa. - Enable the distribution mixer. - A standard gas mix is 79% nitrogen, 21% oxygen. Adjust for crew need.
## 3. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Gyroscopes can be powered down. If your gyroscope appears non functional ensure it has not been deactivated. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled.
